intro: Scleria attenuatifolia, commonly known as the slender flatleaf sedges, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flower heads. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Scleria attenuatifolia is native to parts of Africa and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
